protected_spaces_details.description: Outdoor sports facilities incl school playing fields

description: Provision of sporting facilities comprising the construction of a single storey building incorporating changing facilities, ancillary training/flexible community space and ancillary office accommodation; and the installation of two full size 3G football pitches; and the associated provision of 74 permanent car parking spaces (plus overspill parking for a further 36 cars), floodlighting, boundary treatments, vehicle and pedestrian access off Ruislip Road, and hard and soft landscaping - Regulation 3 (Council's Own Development)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings (titles and numbers):(08) 001 Rev. A00; (08) 002 Rev. A00; (08) 003 Rev. A05; (08) 004 Rev. A04;(08) 005 Rev. A04; (08) 006 Rev. A01; (08) 007A Rev. A01; (08) 007B Rev. A01 (received 04/08/2016); (08) 008 Rev. A00; CPW/15414/M-100 Rev. D1; CPW/15414/M-200 Rev. D1 (received 03/11/2015);(08) 003 Rev. A03; (08) 004 Rev. A03 (received 19/02/2016); and 01 Rev. 00; 01 Rev. 01; 02 Rev. 00; 02 Rev. 06; 03 Rev. 01; 04 Rev. 02; and 05 Rev. 02 (received 26/02/2016) 26/02/2016)
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| No part of the development shall be brought into use until full details of both hard and soft landscape works ( including surface treatment of the footway/cycleway at the entrance of the site) and planting schedule (including a phased programme of works) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first use of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.

REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.17, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.2, 5.4 and 6.3 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012) and policies 5.10 and 5.11 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| No sound amplification devices shall be utilised within the open areas of the site.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.15 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012), Policy 7A of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained within the Council's interim guidance 'Noise and Vibration' (formerly SPG 10 detailing noise criteria).

| Prior to the final completion of the development, the approved sports facilities building shall incorporate the following measures that achieve carbon dioxide emission savings that go beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 as detailed in the approved Sustainability Statement for Planning (13 October 2015) prepared by CouchPerryWilkes:
o	energy saving measures that exceed the compliant Building Regulations Part L 2013 baseline
o	combined heat and power of 15.5kWth and 5.5kWe capacity operating for at least 4,500 hours per year to provide 57.6MWh/yr of energy (equal to 6.5% of total energy required of the development).
o	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 82.5kWp.
The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved Sustainability Statement for Planning and maintained as such thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with FALP 2011/REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| The composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the proposed development, with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided to ensure that the acoustic standard is not greater than LFNR35 Leq,5min (octaves) or LFNR30 Leq,5min (one third octaves) at 1m from the nearest fa√ßade of the nearest affected premises shall be achieved and maintained as such permanently thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Core Strategy (2012) and policies 3.5 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the proposed development with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided to ensure that the rating noise level at sensitive facades, as assessed under BS4142: 1997 shall be lower than the existing background noise level LA90 by at least 5 dBA, during the relevant period of operation and maintained as such permanently thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development Core Strategy (2012) and policies 3.5 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The rating sound level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation, and maintained as such permanently thereafter.

REASON: In order to minimise the emission of noise from the built development proposed to protect the amenities of the area and those of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 7A of Ealing Development Management DPD safeguarding Amenity the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10: 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works, a detailed Construction Logistics Plan (CLP), shall be submitted for the written approval of the Planning Authority and thereafter implemented on-site in the approved manner.  The CLP shall include details of dust mitigation and Noise/Vibration measures as required using Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition', 2006 and in accordance with BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise
The Construction Logistics Plan shall contain:
i) Details of how large construction vehicles will access and egress the site, including routings to the Main Distributor Road network and associated traffic management;
ii) arrangements for vehicle servicing and turning areas;
iii) arrangements for the parking of contractors vehicles;
iv) details of site compound(s) and the location and layout of temporary construction buildings;
v) arrangements for the storage of materials;
vi) details of any lighting of construction areas;
vii) proposed hours of work.

REASON: In the interest of safeguarding the amenity of the surrounding residents and Metropolitan Open Land and to ensure that the implementation of the development does not disrupt the local highway network, in accordance with policies 5.3, 6.11 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015), Policies 5.2 and 7A of the Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and the advice contained within Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: 'Noise and Vibration'.
| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Desk Study (Ground Investigation and Remediation Strategy - Geology, geohydrology and landfilling by soiltechnics.

Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the implemented remediation shall be produced and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The verification report shall be submitted in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1.

REASON: In the interests of the health and safety of the public, in accordance with Policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2015) and Ealing Local Variation to LP Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD 2013.
| Installation of external lighting shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with the details outlined in the Lighting Assessment.
Floodlighting detailed in the application shall not operate beyond 22:00 hours on any day.

REASON: In order to safeguard the amenities and biodiversity value of the area, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.4, 7.17 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and Policy 7A on Amenity of the adopted Development Management DPD (2013) and in the interest of the amenity of the Metropolitan Open Land, ecological interests and the amenity of the surrounding residential occupiers.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations (excluding recommendation 5) detailed in the approved Bat Survey Report by Furesfen, and thereafter operated and permanently maintained in the approved manner.

REASON: In order to protect the biodiversity value of the site and area, in accordance with policies 7.17 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 5.4 of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the conclusions and recommendations detailed in the approved Flood Risk Assessment by Curtins, and thereafter operated and permanently maintained in the approved manner.

REASON: To prevent the increased risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality and to ensure that surface water is disposed of in the most sustainable way feasible, in accordance with policies 5.12, 5.13, 5.14 and 5.15 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.12 of the Development Management DPD (Dec 2013), addressing Flood Risk Management.

| Prior to the construction of those elements of the development to be constructed with brown roofs, details of the proposed roofs, including method of construction and specifications of proposed planting, together with details of future maintenance programmes, shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. Once approved, the development shall be carried out in the approved manner.
REASON: To ensure satisfactory development, in accordance with Policy 5.11 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 5.11 of the Development Management DPD (Dec 2013).

| The premises shall be used as a sports facility for indoor and outdoor sporting activity and for ancillary activities and for no other purpose including any other uses falling within Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) Order 2015.

REASON: In the interests of maintaining an appropriate use within Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies 3.19 and 7.17 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 5.2 and 5.6 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| Prior to the use of the development hereby approved, full details of a Green Travel Plan adopted for the site, with appropriate mechanisms put in place to ensure the requirements of the plan are properly managed and enforced shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Implementation shall be in accordance with approved details.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure appropriate measures are put in place to encourage users of the site to travel to the site by means other than the private car, in accordance with policies 6.9, 6.10 and 6.11 of the London Plan (2015), Policy 1.1 (e), (f), (g) of the (Core) Development Strategy DPD (2012) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document SPD (2013) Sustainable Transport for New Development.

| A minimum of 14 cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the designated area(s), and made available prior to first use of the development and thereafter installed in the agreed locations and retained permanently without obstruction.
REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure accessibility by cycle to the development, in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015).

| The development of the buildings hereby approved shall not commence until full details of the external finishing materials have been submitted to and approved, in writing, by the Local Planning Authority.  The buildings shall thereafter be constructed in accordance with the approved details.
REASON: In the interests of visual amenity, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).

| Prior to the development hereby approved being brought into use, total of 10 active and 5 passive points  Electric Vehicle Charging Points shall be provided within the designated car parking areas.  These Electric Vehicle Charging Points shall be implemented on-site in the approved manner, made available prior to first use of the development.
REASON:  In accordance with Policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Policy 1.2 (k) of Ealing Core Development Strategy (April 2012).

| The development authorised by this permission shall not begin until the local planning authority has approved in writing a full scheme of works for construction of footway returns on both sides of the access. The occupation of the development shall not begin until those works have been completed in accordance with the local planning authority's approval and have been certified in writing as complete by the local planning authority and shall be maintained thereafter.

REASON: To promote sustainable patterns of transport and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety accordance with policies 1.1 f & 2.8 g of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.1, 6.9, 6.10, 6.11, & 6.12 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The kitchen located within the development hereby approved shall only be fitted out with equipment for warming food, and no cooking facilities that necessitate the installation of extract equipment shall be provided.

REASON: To protect residents from odours from cooking, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The dedicated refuse and recycling enclosures for the approved development shown on the approved drawing ref: (08) 008 A00 shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); and (Interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities.
